areaSection: Calpe sits on the northernmost stretch of Costa Blanca's developed coastline, positioned between the dramatic Peñón de Ifach rock formation and sprawling Mediterranean beaches. This strategic location creates unique market dynamics: the town balances year-round residential appeal with peak summer tourism influx, generating consistent rental demand across seasons. Calpe's Mediterranean climate delivers 320+ sunshine days annually, with mild winters (average 12°C) and warm summers (26°C), making the area attractive to Northern European retirees seeking warmth without excessive heat. The town's infrastructure has modernized significantly, with a proposed tram network connecting Calpe to Benidorm and beyond, enhancing accessibility and property valuations. Unlike overdeveloped resort towns, Calpe maintains distinct residential neighborhoods where property appreciation reflects genuine demand rather than speculative bubbles.

The British and German populations have established robust service ecosystems—English-speaking healthcare providers, international schools, and specialized retail cater to non-Spanish residents. Weekly markets supply fresh produce, seafood markets operate daily, and Mercadona/Lidl/Consum supermarkets meet all grocery needs. Restaurant culture ranges from traditional Spanish chiringuitos (beach bars) to international dining, with competitive pricing outside peak tourist seasons. The Arenal-Bol beach, consistently awarded Blue Flag status, lies minutes away, offering safe swimming and water sports. Healthcare quality exceeds regional averages with Centro de Salud Calp supplemented by private clinics maintaining English-speaking staff. This combination—reliable infrastructure, international community integration, and Mediterranean lifestyle—attracts capital-conscious investors seeking properties that generate rental returns while offering personal usage flexibility.

faqs.question: Can non-residents buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Non-residents can freely purchase Spanish property with equivalent legal protections as Spanish citizens. Registration requires obtaining a Spanish tax identification number (NIF), which takes 1-2 weeks. Non-resident taxation applies: 19-21% capital gains tax on appreciation, plus annual wealth tax (0.2-0.75%) on properties exceeding €600,000 value. Rental income requires 19-21% withholding plus subsequent tax reporting. Golden visa programs available for non-EU investors meeting minimum investment thresholds (€500,000+ properties).
